newsitem.title: USA: Strong cash crude prices extend run in U.S. Gulf.
newsitem.headline: Strong cash crude prices extend run in U.S. Gulf.

text.p: Gasoline-driven rallying continued to bolster crude prices in the U.S. Gulf cash markets Wednesday afternoon.
September West Texas Intermediate/Cushing stood close to session highs at $20.20-30 a barrel, some 40 cents higher than Tuesday. September/October spreads hovered at steady levels.

Dealers reported trades for Midland/WTI at 30 cents under September WTI, steady from previous deals. Light Louisiana Sweet/St. James sold at 25 and 26 cents over benchmark, buoyed by favorable spreads against North Sea Brent.
Sour grades also failed to adjust differentials from late yesterday, led by West Texas Sour/Midland selling $1.35 cheaper than WTI/Cushing and Eugene Island at $1.30 off WTI.
September Postings Plus hovered above $2.00, selling at $2.02 and $2.03, benefitting from the even Sep/Oct roll.

Traders cited supportive inventory data as the main reason for the incredibly strong gasoline market. NYMEX August unleaded futures broke through the 70.00 cents level to set new contract highs, after the American Petroleum Institute and Department of Energy released data showing stock draws.
